meanings.definition: To keep afloat or support in water.
meanings.sent1: The life jacket was buoying him up in the deep pool.
meanings.sent2: The inflatable raft was buoying the stranded sailors in the vast ocean.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duckies were buoying up the bath toys in the tub.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was buoying her through the tough times like a life preserver.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons were buoying the spirits of the children at the party.

meanings.sent1: His kind words were buoying her after a long day.
meanings.sent2: The supportive friends were buoying him up before the big presentation.
meanings.sent3: The motivational quotes were buoying her like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: The success of her peers was buoying her to strive for more.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd were buoying his confidence on stage.

meanings.sent1: They were buoying the dangerous rocks in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen were buoying the location of the best fishing spots.
meanings.sent3: The sailors were buoying the safe route through the treacherous waters.
meanings.sent4: The divers were buoying the sunken shipwreck for future exploration.
meanings.sent5: The authorities were buoying the swimming area for the safety of the beachgoers.
